intro: Erodium gruinum f. cuneatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its slender, cuneate (wedge-shaped) leaves and small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands, roadsides, and other open areas. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom from late spring to early summer. The species is known for its rapid growth and ability to colonize new areas, making it a common weed in many regions.
